Sentencas: The reduction behavior of a sintered NiO/YSZ anode used for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells was studied by hydrogen temperature-programmed reduction (H-2-TPR).
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The reduction process of the NiO/YSZ anode in the cell was in situ monitored by open circuit voltage (OCV) and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS).
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: H-2-TPR results show that the higher sintering temperature of the NiO/YSZ anode results in a slower reduction of NiO to metallic Ni.
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, when the sintering temperature is elevated to 1500 degrees C, the reduction of sintered NiO/YSZ anode powder instead becomes easier.
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The higher NiO content in the anode leads to the more rapid reduction of the corresponding anode powder.
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The above H2-TPR results can be attributed to the combined effects of the growth up of NiO particles and the interface separation between NiO and YSZ caused by the anode sintering.
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The variation of OCVs reveals that for the cells, the anode with higher NiO content has a slower reduction process, which can be ascribed to the retarding effect of excessive H2O produced during the initial reduction period.
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It was found from the EIS results that the 50% NiO/YSZ anode has a most stable reduction process, whereas for the cells with 30 % and 70 % NiO/YSZ anodes, both the polarization resistances gradually increase after experiencing an initial decrease for a short period.
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The cell polarization resistance with 30 % NiO/YSZ anode keeps no change any more after reduction for 600 min, whereas the cell polarization resistance with 70 % NiO/YSZ anode increases continuously.
Titulo: The Reduction Process of a NiO/YSZ Anode for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
